title: Energy Sustainability-Based Entrepreneurial Competency Development

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: A MOOC-based learning environment utilizing mixed research methodologies, optimized for smartphone-centric limited-technology settings.

learning_goals: Derive three or more new business models in the renewable energy sector

Learners analyze energy market data (prices, supply/demand trends, policy changes) within six months to predict regional plastic recycling potential, and produce a 20-page report evaluating economic and environmental feasibility, referencing ≥5 data sources and comparing ≥3 recycling technology scenarios.

Learners derive ≥3 actionable energy project ideas based on hydrocarbon market trend analysis and develop 10–15-page project proposals including technical, economic, and environmental feasibility assessments.

Learners manage 4-week team projects (3–5 members) using online collaboration tools (Notion, Trello, Slack), submitting deliverables meeting ≥80% weekly goal achievement, ≥3 weekly communications, and ≥4/5 fairness in task distribution (rubric-based).

Learners draft a decision-making framework for a given corporate scenario within four weeks, considering three sustainability metrics (environmental, social, economic), and achieve ≥80% fulfillment in peer reviews and expert feedback.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
